We have designed, built, and tested the Smart Tracker prototype and software. We have selected a well-respected production facility that we have previously worked with successfully. 
However, one of our biggest concerns was making Smart Tracker affordable to the largest amount of people possible, while still insisting on a rich feature set. In order to proceed, we need to create the tooling and order quantity necessary to keep the price reasonable for everyone involved. 
That is why you are our most important asset! By working together, we can all benefit from this. 
By donating to our indiegogo campaign, you are guaranteeing that customers looking for a quality, cost-effective magnetic  GPS tracker system can be served. As we are not relying on our own incomes to get this product line started, we can make sure that the price is considerably lower to purchase on the consumer side further down the line. 









By investing in our project, your pre-orders will help to fund the first production run in a quantity that keeps the price low for everyone. In return you get (besides our gratitude and sincere thanks!) a totally new kind of Smart GPS TRACKER at a highly discounted price.
More than that, you join us and make a statement about the importance of technology and security.
We have created several different perks to offer Smart Tracker at prices up to 60% off of retail price, as well as some special perks.

Stretch Goals :













We have developed a rigorous testing and quality control process to insure your Smart Tracker arrives in perfect condition. The packaging is designed and we have a partner waiting to produce it. We have investigated and secured the logistics partners needed for safe delivery worldwide. 





A NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS:
Please note:  Backers will be responsible for any and all customs, import duties, and local taxes you may incur in your country of residence.  We recommend you ask your local tax authorities what you will incur based on the value of your pledge.  Please understand that we have no control over what your own country will charge you in VAT and import duties.  As a final note, we cannot misrepresent the customs information.  We appreciate your understanding in this matter.





GPS tracking devices have become incredibly important to daily life, both for individuals as well as for business. For companies who run primarily through delivery shipments and cargo, a GPS tracking device can ensure the security of the cargo, compare driver’s planned routes against their actual travel time, length of the trip, and more. Using a GPS device can also ensure that a wayward employee doesn’t wander away with a company vehicle without prior authorization from the company itself. 




Personal use of GPS tracking devices has also grown in scope and necessity, as well. From tracking a possible instance of infidelity, keeping an eye on a teenage driver (Smart Tracker has a Speeding alert), or protecting the safety of an older loved one suffering from memory loss, dementia, or Alzheimer's, using a GPS tracking device can mean the difference between love and loss, life and death. Finding a GPS unit that can accomplish all of these tasks, maintain a low profile, and remain affordable to both a business owner as well as a private consumer, while being user-friendly, can be difficult to find, especially all in one package. 




What is the timeline ?





Disclaimer


Delivery of rewards/perks is subject to our best efforts and not guaranteed. This is to set reasonable expectations for our contributors/donors. This disclaimer is required for accepting PayPal contributions.
Do I have to pay a subscription?
No,  you will benefit as customer of a free web interface lifetime. You can also track your Smart Tracker for free with your phone (Working with Google map, compatible Android/iOS/Windows Phone).
Do I need a SIM card ?
Smart Tracker has a BlackBox function, if you need passive tracking without real-time tracking you don't need a SIM.
However, if you want real-time tracking, you need to take a cheap sim (Smart Tracker only use a minimum data and is cost-effective). There is no miracle for this type of technology, Tracker without SIM only give you a coverage of maximum 1km. Smart Tracker works World Wide!

Does the product come with a Warranty?
1.    All orders will be in perfect quality, package condition and will be strictly checked before shipment. 
2.  All orders enjoy 12 months of quality warranty since shipment. We always offer free repairs, whether it’s within or outside of warranty period, but buyers need pay for the accessories cost and shipping cost.

What are the Shipping Costs?
There is an additional small cost incurred for international shipping, which varies depending of your country. Shipment does not include extra fees from customs, or additional costs associated with your country.
Will this Tracker work world wide? 
Absolutely!

Will you consider giving the option to choose a
product without a logo or any other external feature that will apply that this
is tracking device?
We can
provide the Smart Tracker without the logo, it's not a problem but you should
ask us so we note it. Color can be customized according to our Stretch Goal.
Can you provide the product specs? Can you
provide images of the internal product (PCB)?
We still
have some adjustments to do to the Smart Tracker and prefer not to give information
that may change. However, we can guarantee all Smart Tracker will be shipped in
June, we are improving some details of Smart Tracker.
Does it use a lot of data ?
No, Smart Tracker is very economic and any standard cheap sim would work without any problems for real-time tracking. If you don't use real-time tracking, you can still get position by simply sending an sms (no need of internet data).
Example :
You wish to track in real-time every 30 seconds:
Data used for one day is only 0.32mb and for one month only 9.6mb. 
Does it work in my country?
Smart Tracker works everywhere, for real-time tracking usage, you need a GSM network (ST uses GPRS signal). It can work anywhere in America or Europe for example.

Feel free to ask us any questions you may have, we will update our FAQ once we received more questions.




 
Win a Free Smart Tracker with a Simple Click
We are ready to offer you up to 10 Smart Tracker in exchange for you helping  to spread the word. When you share our project using the share button, it creates a special link designed only for you. With this link, we will be able to track the number of visits and sales that you are bringing to our project.

story:
About Me and "Angela Huang Spring/Summer 2014 Collection"

I am an ambitious young Fashion Designer base in Vancouver, BC. I’m also a 20-year-old student from Kwantlen Polytechnic University's Bachelor of Fashion Design and Technology Program. I have decided to showcase my first complete collection of 8 to 12 looks at the Spring/Summer 2014 Vancouver Fashion Week in September 2013.

I am personally designing, drafting, cutting and sewing every single piece in my collection. I know it takes a long time to create my line if I’m doing it all by myself but I want this collection to be something very special. This collection will be personal and meaningful to me so I would like to build it all from scratch by myself. It will be by far my biggest milestone and accomplishment.  

It is important for emerging designers like myself to showcase their work on an international platform and I believe Vancouver Fashion Week is the perfect stage for me. However, I need funding to make this all happen. I need your help to make this dream of mine come true.

 

What I Need & What You Get

What I need is very simple: funds to build my collection and pay for showcasing fee.

I need funds to cover my material cost (drafting papers, fabrics, notions… and much more). It will total up to about $700 or more depending on my choice of material.

The showcasing fee for Emerging Designers at Vancouver Fashion Week is $1,800.

I know my funding goal ($1,500) does not equal my total ($700+$1,800=$2,500) but I can try and cover the rest. So, please help me reach my funding goal!

Let me know if you have any questions about my campaign. I am more than happy to answer them.

 

The Impact

You are not only funding my Spring/Summer 2014 Collection but also supporting my dream and future. You are supporting a young fashion designer with ambitions and talent. I don’t want to miss my chance to showcase on an international platform due to financial reasons. If I don’t reach my funding goal I will find other ways to showcase at Fashion Week but your help will certainly make a huge difference!

So, please take a look at the perks on the right side of the page. If you are willing to contribute, please select any perk(s) you like and support me!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even a dollar or two is fine! I am already grateful that people are willing to read this campaign so if you personally cannot help me then please share my campaign on your social media pages or to friends and family. Please share this with anyone you think will be interested in supporting me. Please help my dream come true.

 

Visit my website at www.angelahuangdesign.com

 

Thank You For Your Contribution and Support!

story:
We’ve all been there… you get all dressed up, put on your brand new kicks and… someone steps on your shoe!!! With a quick swipe of your hand, you begin to brush as must dirt off as possible, left only with the option of waiting to get home to pull out the infamous “toothbrush” and liquid chemicals to properly clean them.  Well that is now a thing of the past. I would like to introduce to you, the world’s first portable instant shoe cleaner, “SNEAKERDINI”.

 

SNEAKERDINI is the perfect mate to any shoe/sneaker with a sole. SNEAKERDINI was created to provide a quick, instant shoe relief while on the go and is the perfect companion for all SNEAKER lovers... And did I mention, completely portable. SNEAKERDINI is small enough to fit on your keychain, but with cleaning power big enough to keep your shoes as clean as the day they were pulled from the box. SNEAKERDINI is chemical free and so simple to use, man, woman or child can use it.  

 

All you have to do is follow 3 easy steps:

 

(1)
Remove the Velcro end cap
(2)
Dampen the foam end and gently scrub your shoe
(3)
Remove the Finger Hanky from the bottom cap, wipe clean and replace

 

*Finger Hanky is washable

*Replacement Foam is available for purchase

 

SNEAKER-heads all over the world need this product on the shelves. Therefore, contributions are greatly appreciated. $1.00 is all that it takes. All proceeds goes directly to the production anddistribution of the product.

 

All questions can be directed to admin@sneakerdini.com

 

Thank you in advance and God bless!

story:
"Hi, l’m Tim in Horsham, UK.

I design, engineer and build mechanical watches in Switzerland. My passion is to create watches that are the perfect partner for driving down the Californian coast road at the wheel of a classic American car.



My new watch is the Sunliner. The 42mm case is mirror polished stainless steel and the cream dial is embellished with individual hour markers that l riveted on myself. The watch is powered by a Swiss ETA 2824-4 automatic winding movement which is visible through the case back window. The hands are polished needlepoint with a retro aqua-green second hand. 

The case is fitted with a slightly curved sapphire crystal to the front and a toughened mineral glass to the back.

I do all of my own font design and l am particularly pleased with my Sunliner logo.

The Sunliner features an engraved crown with a '50s atomic motif.



I make my own watch straps using a unique leather l call Aqualux. It maintains its’ matt finish and evolves with wear to become soft and silky smooth. The Sunliner will have a mid brown leather upper with a cool retro green interior leather liner. The strap is finished off with a stainless steel butterfly deployment clasp.


The first Sunliner under construction

The photos are of the prototype that l made, so there is still some work to do to complete these. If you can support me in my efforts to bring the Sunliner into life with the production of the first few editions, then there will be a build time of around 16 weeks, (takes ages to get the case back engraving done in Switzerland for example plus l will most likely hit the summer break when all of Switzerland shuts down).

This is my Coastliner model. It has a 40mm diameter stainless steel case with similar hands to the Sunliner. The cream dial (more cream than the images show) has a '50s abstract relief pattern to the centre and my trademark aqua- green second hand that matches the leather strap interior.

The Coastliner also has a georgeous engraving of the Coastliner script logo to the side of the case.

The Coastliners are also powered by the Swiss ETA 2824-2 automatic winding movement which is visible through the exhibition case back. The case is topped off with a slightly curved sapphire crystal and a toughened mineral glass is fitted to the back.

I designed the Coastliner and the Sunliner while visiting a Goodguys classic car show in the States.

My watches all have screw-down case backs (that’s the best type with the tiny
screws, as opposed to the whole case back screwing on which is called screw-on case back), and are watertight to 5 ATM.

It has taken me a while to get to this point but l now have 4 gorgeous Coastliners available, boxed and ready to ship.

It would be a great help if l could get some pledges for the Sunliner. This watch deserves to be out there on the wrists of people who share my passion for good design and those heady days of the ‘50s.

If you are tired of the famous watch brands and want something truly exclusive then Automatic Watch Company is for you.

If you aren't looking to buy a watch at the moment but like what l am doing then please do tell all your friends and thanks for looking."


Perks

The Coastliner and Sunliner watches would normally retail at $1330 and $2090 respectively. I am offering both models at special Indiegogo rates of $835, $895, $995 and $1086 for each of the Coastliners, and $1214 and $1422 for each of the Sunliners.

These prices are subject to shipping and, if you live within the EEC, to VAT at 20% .

There will be a few more of each model available via my web site if you miss this great offer.

www.automaticwatchcompany.com

Just some of my equipment that l use to prototype and develop my watches.


My trusty old lathe that l make my prototypes on


Micro drill


leather skiver


hand polished case

story:
PunkTrek - The secret life of lights

I am Csaba Molnár.

The PunkTrek lamps are unique, handmade products, which I’ve been preparing for more than one year now.
These are cute and sometimes astounding home decorations. 
I enjoy to use wide range of raw materials. I love rethink, remodel old, worn-out items, and combined old and new technologies. 
The lamps have personality. Qualitative products and also illuminate.

I made my first lamp for my wife, it's name is our lamp family. 

It had a great feedbacks from our friends, many people suggested, that I should continue creating lamps. 

So did I.

What I do.

I would like to create the following 3 categories of products:

1. Unique table, -wall, -mood lamps, and chandelier

These are already prepared.

You can view below link: www.punktrek.com

2. Do it yourself lamp

Semi-finished products, so-called 'do it yourself' lamp:)

These products are for those, who are enjoying to prepare, painting, but don't wan’t to do the electrical installation.
Therefore I do foundations, electrical part, and drilling, meanwhile the necessary materials for decoration is enclosed in the package.

The first 'do it yourself' lamp is chicken-lamp.

You can see the sample below link: www.punktrek.com/diy

Contents of the package:

- Two pieces of tile.
- Bamboo sticks for legs, and fasteners.
- Cable and switch with plug fitted ready for final assembly. When ordering, you can select the color and material of cable, you can choose from 52 colors, fabric or flax cable. 

(Cables made by Tilka)
- Socket and bulb.
- 3 cans of paint (when ordering you can choose paint color)

The second 'do it yourself' lamp is "Family-lamp".

Coming Soon - 2014 July


3. Create an individual lamp based received material.

I conjure unique lamp from your old teddy bear or your grandma’s meat-grinder.
The first step is to customer sent me a photograph of the object, the dimensions and any wishes.
Based on this photo, I make some plan, and budget plan.
If you like either one, you can post me the object, and the work is starting…:)

You can watch such a transformation on:  www.punktrek.com/memories


Contacts

You can see previous works below:

www.etsy.com
www.punktrek.com
Facebook

Objectives

I turned to Community Funding, because I would like to develop my own enterprise (PunkTrek)

I like to establish a manufactory, where we produce specific and / or limited edition products with high quality.

Primary goals:

1. rent workshop, expansion product-palette.
2. Buying tools
3. Buying raw materials
4. Marketing
5. In the future open my own shop

1. Workshop:

Now, I work in my little flat, on a little table.
I would like to rent a workshop, where I can develop my creativity.

2. Machine, tools:

I should buy some essential machines/tools. 
So I can work faster and more efficiently.

3. Raw materials:

So that it can realize my ideas, I need necessary more and more materials. Therefore I like to expand my stock.

4. Marketing:

Nowadays advertising is vital important. How it could play out in the general public with news, that PunkTrek lives and works. :)

5. Own shop:

In the future I would like to open a shop, where an open workshop gets a place too.
Here, anyone can see, purchase our products, but also provide a space for public works.

Financing

At the begining I have received great support from my family and friends. As a result I could lay a base of new business.
But to proceed outside help is needed, therefore, is to start a Indiegogo-project.

Depending on the support I plan to the next steps:

4000 $ - Raw materials and Marketing

Raw Materials:

- Electrical installation materials: fabric cables, sockets, bulbs, switches, etc..
- Precious metal sheets, rods and tubes: copper, bronze and aluminum.
- Vintages: for example, old copper and brass bowls, binoculars, boxes, lamps.

Marketing:

- google adwords, etsy.com
- business card, exhibitions and events.

10.000 $ - Workshop and expansion of 'Do it yourself' lamp palette

Workshop:

- 40 m2 small workshop and warehouse rental, equipment. Bench drilling, welding transformer

Do it yourself' lamp:

- Preparation of other types
- The quality packing boxes, designing, manufacturing.

20.000 $ - Machine fleet expansion

60.000 $- Opening Design shop and Open workshop

Gifts

I want to give away small gifts for those who are supporting the project.

You can download on the following link high-resolution images of my creations, for decorating your home, office after printing. 
The list of images continues to grow.

www.punktrek.com/download

Thank you so much!

story:
The Slim Traveler pill box !

What it is:

A thin comfortable pill container--a stylish personal accessory -- that loves to travel!! :)

What it isn't:

A big bulky weekly pill organizer—that likes to sit at home and watch TV. :(

 

 

The Slim Traveler is as thin as a smart phone and as small as a credit card!

The "Slim Traveler" pill box: Easily slides into a pocket, purse, or backpack to carry your pills & vitamins, mints & gum. --Small & Thin!

 

 7 colors to choose from!

 

 Carry pills and vitamins comfortably!

 

As thin as a smart phone!

 

 

As small as a credit card!

 

 An edgy look with a carbon fiber texture!

 

 

 

Carry a variety of items from Tylenol to gum, use your creativity!

 

Fits your Lifestyle !

 

A pocket in your jeans

 

 

 A purse

 

 

A backpack

 

 

Ski, Snowboard, or golf bag

 

Take it with you to the gym 

 

 

Or to a meeting

 

 

Traffic headache--Handy to have one in the car too

 

Here is where it all started:

We went on a trip last spring-- we did a lot of hiking, boating, cycling, and even rented some scooters for a day (ya I know- Harley’s would have been cooler!). Anyway, we had to carry a few pills with us, and wanted to take some gum etc. So I ended up carrying this bulky plastic pill bottle around with different pills and some gum  in my front pocket for a few days. Every time we needed something I would dump it out in my hand and sort through them.  It got uncomfortable and pretty annoying; (I’m a travel light kinda guy!) I looked all around for a thin cool looking pill case while we were there and couldn't find one. When I got home I looked online and around the stores and still couldn't find one I liked. So, I decided to create what I wanted—& thought others might like it too!

 

The evolution of thought and development:

 

First sketch, not drawn on a napkin--but close! Finished product is roughly 2" x 3" and less than 1/2" thick.

Then I created the "first" computer drawing with a latch like the one on the sketch.

 

This is a resin prototype from the first computer drawing to get a general feel--I wanted something I could hold in my hand to see if I was even in the ballpark.?...Lots of issues to sort out!!

 

 

First prototype mold with our new custom designed latch feature for a more secure hold.

 

 

Second revision prototype mold, with this revision I wanted to thicken walls to give it more rigidity, strengthen all parts, and add some  text cues inside.

At this point I had several made and handed them out to a group of people I knew to test them --the price of friendship :)!  I got some good feedback. I decided to loose the MTWHF thing, I was thinking weekender, but it just confused people. We just went to the simplified 1234 --organize as you will--or not... Trying one out myself I decided to give the latch pads just a bit more surface area as well, just enough to keep it slim in your pocket, but make it easier to open. I also decided to roll with the new latch design it worked great! It stays closed much better than the former latch, and as a bonus it works well for righties and lefties! So back to the drawing board for some final changes.

 

Ah-the final drawing...Ya!!

 

 

Prototype mold 3 revision completed to make the changes, send the mold out for texturing and we're close!

Oh, also I added the word "Lift" on the tab--always good to know which way is up! :)

The new texture disappointed me at first, you could hardly see it, $1000. bucks to texture 1 prototype cavity--I expected more...!  So I got some metal polish and a micro fiber cloth, grabbed a drink, put on some tunes and "carefully" hand polished the final prototype mold for hours...

 

...but with this new polished look--worth every minute!

And final prototype design is done--Awesome!

 

Lien the title of your best car & spend a year developing a product--a challenging but fun process!!

But whats even better...the people that tested the final product REALLY liked it! Helps make it all worth while...I hope you really like it too!

 

So why do I need you as a funder?

I've proofed the concept, design, and prototypes, I have a functional prototype mold that I can make a few parts from, and I've created a website MedicineGear.com as a platform to eventually sell from. But-- there is a long way to go! The funds I receive will be used for:

  • First item of business will be to create a polished production mold! Trying to fill orders with a single cavity prototype mold is like trying to paint your living room with a 1 inch brush, or mow your lawn with a line trimmer--it probably could be done, but would not be pleasant! You really need a roller and a mower! In this case I really need a production mold-- these molds are very expensive but produce more parts more efficiently with less waste.  Actually allowing you to fill multiple orders and compete in the market place. 
  • Secondly we need to fulfill the Perks to a very diserving group of people!!!
  • Then,  we will need to produce inventory to fill orders and to stock the shelf for efficient fulfillment.
  • Finally, there will be mailer packaging, and eventually store hang packs etc.

I found some competitive pricing close to home. They will be produced here in the USA.  I will fulfill orders out of my home, garage, storage room & possibly the neighbors garage when they're not looking :). 

Please help us spread the word, and pass this campaign along to others you think might also be interested!

So in short; I'm very appreciative of your contributions, your help & support--Thank you!

 

Here are some photos of the Perks:

 

First of course is a Slim Traveler pill box! Some like the very subtle Back or the distinguished Pewter Grey, while others like a fun bright color that can easily found inside your purse or pack!

 

 

 

Next is a T-Shirt, custom printed with the Slim Traveler & Medicine Gear Logo! Choose Black or White!

 

Thanks again for your support---Awesome and Appreciated!!!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Mark Alexander

Experience consulting on new projects, managing product development, designing & marketing. Received his bachelors and masters work from Utah State University. Has worked in outside environments, hospital environments, and has been a client liaison for engineering companies. Has founded businesses, and currently owns A-Innovations, Inc. a home based business set up to foster idea development----And is now starting this exciting new venture "The Slim Traveler" pill box with www.medicinegear.com as a venue for future sales!

Mark bootstrapped the majority of each former business, product, and project. These projects have provided him with a wealth of knowledge and experience, helping him gain understanding for current & future endeavors.

Mark enjoys a rich family life and many hobbies and interests including: water skiing, wake boarding, riding stand-up jet skis, snow skiing, hiking, mountain biking, as well as riding motorcycles & four wheeler's. This season he attempted to snowboard--not pretty!

story:
Hello Lovelies

We're the Pantsu Patrol, a new cosplay trio that's currently aspiring to make it into the semi-professional field of cosplay modeling.  We want to raise $3,000 so that we can go to Fan Expo Canada in Toronto, Ontario in the hopes of networking and working towards working in this fantastically creative field.

For every $15 we raise, we will post a picture from one of the several photoshoots we did recently.  And  trust me, we have lots of cute ones to share with you ;)

What We Need and What We'll Give 

We need to raise enough money to cover hotel, plane tickets, and con passes.  Unfortunately, travel within Canada is ridiculously expensive, and that's why we need your help!

Obviously we wouldn't ask for anything without giving you something in return.  We did several shoots lately so that we will make sure to post a photo for every $15 we raise in total.  

In addition, we plan on setting up the following perks:

Donate $10, and we will make a fan sign post just for you

Donate $30, and we will send out a print of your choice, absolutely free.

Donate $75, and we will send out a print of your choice, along with a small gift.

Donate $125, and we will send out two prints of your choice, a card, and a small giftie! 

Why We're Doing This

We are very passionate about costume making and hosting events, and we feel that cosplay is a great medium for these passions.  We would love to make a larger contribution in the semi-professional business of cosplay so that we can let our passions grow and network and connect with all like-minded creative people.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute, please do spread this post around!  We're grateful for any sort of help we can get <3

story:
Short Summary

This is a two piece retractable dog leash holder one piece will mount just out side of your door and other will attach to your retractable leash. This all started when my brothers kids were letting the dog out in the winter they would let the dog run out on the leash and then shut the door on the leash so we came up with this. What we need is the money to get a mold to make these This product will be good for people in the winter or when it is raining. It will be good for apartments conduminiums cabins in the woods rvs campers horse trailers anywhere you cant put a corkscrew tie out

 

 

 

 

. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

  what we need is donation to get this product out we know that everone loves there pet but not at all times like when it is cold or raining the ez dog walker will let you let your pet out with out having to go out with it. You can see how this product works at ez dog walker .com

 

    The Impact

    Me and my brothers are factory works and construction people that have come up with a new product and need your help to get this to market. We have never done any thing like this but we think we have something that people with pets will use

     

       

         

          Risks & Challenges

          The biggest risk that we have is to get the product in front of people and trying to keep up with the challenge of marketing and demand. We need your help to spread the word of this product to fellow pet owners

           

             

              Other Ways You Can Help

              Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

              • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
              • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

              And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What is the LANI?

The LANI is a beautiful art piece and storage device.  With your help we would love to make our idea a reality, and help bring beauty storage out of your drawers and onto to your walls.   As space is limited in most homes and apartments,  it can be difficult to find space to store your cosmetics. The LANI will help us store toiletries and cosmetics in a beautiful way. Each LANI is made of injection molded ABS plastic and is equipped with hardware and traditional holes that are strong enough to hold almost anything to the wall. The LANI can easily be mounted to any wall.  We are here to raise the funds for the the initial injection molds and first run of product.  Please pledge today to help bring this fun, beautiful, and affordable product to market. Thank you, from the Entire LANI Team. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for your contribution to help get The LANI ORGANIZER produced.
  • You contribution will go to producing Injection Molds, Product, Packaging and distribution. 
  • For your contribution you receive a beautiful piece of functional storage.


The Impact

  • We love the American spirit and are representative of a new breed of entrepreneurs from the heart of America....DETROIT CITY!  We live and breath the American dream everyday.  As a small business owner in today's environment, we are familiar with the challenges of staying competitive, making a living, and adding value to our community.  Our goal with The LANI ORGANIZER, is to provide added value to our consumer, Enriching your live with Beauty and Function, while supporting local manufacturing and our American Community.


What is the LANI made from and How is it made?

  • The LANI Organizer is made of high quality, injection molded, ABS plastic.  ABS plastic is flexible, strong, and lightweight.  
  • In order to produce the product, Large Billet Aluminum Molds are Made, A Computer controlled machine will mill out an impression of each piece. Once the two items are etched with the design the two pieces are place together to create a mold for the piece.
  • The molds are then placed on a large Injection Mold Machine, and literally Injected with Molten ABS Plastic.
  • Once the Plastic has sufficiently cooled, The Molds are separated and out pops a completed product. 
  • We will give each and every product a final inspection before we box and ship your product to your door.  Awww yeah!



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help get the word out.  If you like our product, let a friend know.
  • Share our page
  • Tweet us!
  • Friend us!
  • Blog us!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.


Risks and Delivery 

  • We've done our best to keep the risks and challenges to a minimum for this project. While manufacturing projects can be high dollar endeavors, we're keep this project very simple with proven injection molding techniques.  In addition we are using a highly regarded and reputable company within the industry.
  • We will provide regular updates, letting you know exactly what we are up to, and when you can expect to receive your LANI. 
  • Our expected date of delivery will be approximately 4-6 months after we receive funding.
  • Due to the manufacturing process involved, things take time.  But rest assured we will be working diligently to meet your expectations. 

FAQ 

Why are you doing crowd-funding?

The initial tooling required to produce the LANI is very expensive.  Nearly 80 % of the total funds we raise will go into securing the molds necessary to produce our product.

If we achieve our goal, then we will the be able to make many variations of our product,

Do I need to add the cost of shipping to my pledge?

If you live in the US shipping is free. Other countries, please add the amount specified. Local import taxes may apply.

What currency contribution amount is based on?

It is US dollars.

When can I expect my delivery?

Once we have reached our funding goal we can then secure the production time, tooling and raw material and begin production.  We have factored a 4-6 month window to achieve delivery.  

Will there be updates

We will send out regular updates and keep everyone in the loop. 

More questions?

Email us at nick.brown75@yahoo.com

Due to the manufacturing process involved, things take time.  But rest assured we will be working diligently to meet your expectations.

Other countries, please add the amount specified. Local import taxes may apply.What currency contribution amount is based on?It is US dollars.When can I expect my delivery?Once we have reached our funding goal we can then secure the production time, tooling and raw material and begin production.  We have factored a 4-6 month window to achieve delivery.  Will there be updatesWe will send out regular updates and keep everyone in the loop. More questions?Email us at nick.brown75@yahoo.com

story:
What's The Grand Owl?

This is our first Campaign, We’re as passionate about design, comfort and style as you are. We know that a wallet says more about a man than just his money. We know that it says who you are.

We created Grand Owl with that idea in mind. Our exclusive designs and
popular look draws heads. And unlike those retail-markup designer brands
that cost an arm and a leg, Grand Owl leather wallets won’t break the bank.

They may cost a fraction of the price, but they deliver superior quality and
durability. Grand Owl wallets are made to last. Each is made with these
three key details in mind:

When designing this Wallet, we made sure of THREE details:

  • A minimalist sleek look that can be matched with a casual or
    professional wardrobe;
  • Only made with the highest quality materials available;
  • Outstanding comfort and security.






Color Options
Our first style 'The Grand Owl' is available  in 4 matte colors. It's made from a durable quality leather that will last years.



The Grand Owl is backed with a warranty. If there’s any problem with the
Grand Owl or you’re just not satisfied with it, return it for a full refund.

If funded, how will you fulfill the orders?

In preparation of our ordering process, we’ve come-up with several designs and  finalized one which seems to be perfect look and preference. The design has been finalized with high quality leather being supplied by a selected special manufacturer who has a great reputation in the industry. Once we access funding, we can make the initial deposit to begin production. Production time will take roughly 30 days (1 month) depending on the quantity and urgency of the order. Our team will then ship the orders to our awesome backers! 

We need your Support!

We thank you for taking your time to check out on our campaign! Without your support we can not take this to next level. We would highly appreciate you sharing this with your friends out there. Once again, receive our warm regards.

If you have any questions or enquiry, be sure to contact us at support@thegrandowl.com

story:
The Uncommon Wallet embraces the spirit of local craftsmanship through a design that unravels the spools of convention.

Through the journey of product creation, we offer full transparency behind our story and love of craft to the Kickstarter community.  Having worked with leather goods for years, myself and local artisans have created the Uncommon Wallet in bi-fold and tri-fold construction.  

"Using timeless elements and lasting construction techniques we created a design that better fits our aesthetic and lifestyle."

After one year, my wallet has a nice worn feel and look. 

Features

The showcase feature places a visible pocket on the exterior of the wallet making it seamless to display your ID at bars or swipe your monthly pass on public transportation.  

Showcase Bi-Fold Wallet

Showcase Tri-Fold Wallet

*All images are shown with red stitching.  Purists can select matching thread and leather color. 

"What started out as a mission for self, we began making these wallets not only for us but for others too."

 -----

By using the left side pocket to secure your cash, the design eliminates any pouch which eliminates unnecessary layers.  

Interior Bi-Fold

Interior Tri-Fold

" We sought to create a wallet that was thoughtful, simplistic and enduring."

Never cutting corners when it comes to the finest craftsmanship, the highest quality goes into the creation of your wallet.  For the stitching, we used Lin Cable thread which is twined and waxed for rugged good looks and durability.  

" We sought to create a wallet that was thoughtful, simplistic and enduring."

Never cutting corners when it comes to the finest craftsmanship, the highest quality goes into the creation of your wallet.  For the stitching, we used Lin Cable thread which is twined and waxed for rugged good looks and durability.  

Embossed Logo (on exterior corner)

----

Stitching

Select from the below thread colors to make the wallet of your choice. Purists can choose matching black or brown threads (not shown),

-------

There is a risk that the goal of $3,000 will not be reached.  If this is the case, we have a strong community of local artisans that are looking forward to handcraft your custom wallet, and will do so closer to cost.

story:
My Story

Since birth I have been fascinated with art and all that it has to offer. I was never extremely talented at drawing, painting or sculpting but I always had that artistic drive. It is something I've constantly worked at and tried to polish my skills over the years. It is also a therapeutic process for me, and I'm going to school to be able to share this type of therapy with others. I found graphic design a couple years ago, which helped me showcase my creative thoughts in a clean, neat way. Along with loving art, I've always loved t-shirts. I would like to meld my creations into a wearable art display. Donating will help me achieve my dreams of building a t-shirt design company. Thank you for your support, and help. It means the world to me.


What We Need & What You Get

The funds are all going towards costs for raw materials and the printing process, this also means a better t-shirt quality. After price checking with multiple companies and finally finding one that has amazingly soft, durable, and beautiful printing and calculating totals $1,500 came to be the low estimate.


I understand times are tough, and wallets are lighter so to show you how much I appreciate your donations there's a list of perks!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate but would like to help, please pass this on to anyone you think would be interested.

story:
Introducing the Trifecta Unicorn of Women’s Socks...stylish, comfortable, and affordable.

You’ve sent us hundreds of emails requesting it.  We asked for your help with styles, designs, and colors with overwhelming response.  Now with your help, we’ve designed a great lineup to launch Sock 101’s women’s line and sock of the month club just for you!

About Sock 101

Sock 101 launched in November of 2012 with a mission to offer high quality, stylish socks without the big price tag.

We saw a problem:  people were paying $15, $25, and more for a pair of colorful and stylish socks.  We were tired of it.  We set out to create colorful, stylish, and professional socks and sell them for $7.  

Without any experience in the fashion industry, and with the help of talented designers and our manufacturer, we did it!

We now make stylish, comfortable, AND affordable socks.  Lea’s wife Ashley lovingly says, Sock 101 has created the “Trifecta Unicorn” of socks.

In under two years, we’ve come a long way!

We started with six pairs of $7 socks.  We now offer a lineup of over 50 pairs, including premium and limited edition socks.

We rolled out a sock of the month club (learn more here) that now boasts over 1,000 members.

Last October, we launched a Kickstarter campaign and managed to raise $30,342.  This set our company in a new trajectory, and we’ve continued to grow ever since.

We’ve collaborated with organizations such as the Negro Leagues Museum in Kansas City to help raise awareness and funds for their mission.

Coming off the success of our Kickstarter campaign last year, we partnered with Les Norman in the “Create Happy Feet” campaign benefiting City Union Mission.  We donated over 500 pairs of new socks to help clothe the homeless.

We've come a long way!  But, our work is never done!

Next Step:  Women’s Line

At your request, our next step is to roll out a women’s line.

Based on all the emails we received from you, we now know that women have the same problem as men!  Women tend to pay upwards of $20 for a pair of colorful socks!

Now, we are excited to bring our Trifecta Unicorn ways of doing things to you through our women’s line and sock of the month club.

We teamed up with our designers and you, our loyal customers, to create a mix of unique designs for calf and knee high socks with the same affordable pricing.  

We are looking to sell calf-high socks for $7 and knee-high socks for $10.  

This is a savings of over 50% from what you would find at some of the big retailers!

What We Need & What You Get

We are now asking for $10,000 on Indiegogo to get our Women’s Line off the ground.  Even after all of our research and surveys, we want to make sure this is something you want while raising money to fund our initial order.

How Funds Will Be Spent

All funds will go to the purchase of inventory for the women’s line, design of new socks, and future production of our women’s sock of the month club.  

After raising over $30,000 last fall on Kickstarter, we would love to blow the $10,000 number away to create some awesome socks for you this holiday season.  The more we raise, the more we are able to put toward design and production of our women’s line and sock of the month club.

Perks

You can get great deals on our socks and sock of the month club through our perks that are not normally offered through our website.

Be sure to get in early on our great early bird specials!

These perks apply to our men’s and women’s line.  You can mix and match men’s and women’s socks as part of your perk.  Get socks for yourself and give some to that special someone in your life for the holidays or special occasion.

We also have two high dollar perks that are amazing deals on custom logo socks.  

For $2,500, we will design and manufacture to your specifications 250 pairs of custom logo socks for you, your business, or organization. (some restrictions apply)

For $5,000, we will design and manufacture to your specifications 750 pairs of custom logo socks for you, your business, or organization. (some restrictions apply)

To see more about our custom logo design and manufacture process, head here.

How You Can Help

1. Make A Pledge to Sock 101 And Get Socks in Return

Make a pledge by choosing a perk that fits you.  Together, we can attempt to bring everyone cool socks.

2. Share the Sock 101 Story

Share our Campaign via email, Facebook, Twitter, phone calls, text messages and through old fashioned conversations.

3. Give Us Feedback

Sock 101 wants to hear from you.  What do you think of Sock 101?  What could Sock 101 do better?  What sock designs do you want to see? The more feedback you provide, the better product Sock 101 can provide for you.

4.  Like Sock 101 on Facebook or Follow Us on Twitter or Instagram

https://www.facebook.com/Sock101

https://twitter.com/thesock101

www.instagram.com/thesock101

Testimonials

Of course we think Sock 101 is awesome, but don’t take our word for it.  Check out what some of our customers, including a pretty cool former President have to say:

Your thoughtful gift just reached me and I am very thankful for your generosity.  The “Johnny-football socks” will be perfect for days in College Station.

Good luck on your latest endeavor.

All the best,

George Bush

I love my socks! They are sooo comfortable! - Sherry C.

I wanted to give you some positive feedback. About two months ago I found my husband browsing the internet for some fun new socks to jazz up his outfits (my words not his). I remembered seeing a post of yours about your new sock business, so I looked it up and gave him the site. He liked them all, so bought a pair of each. After wearing each at least once, he loves the look AND comfort/quality. Good work, son! Take care. - Summer M.

I am a member of the "Sock of the Month" club and love, love, love my monthly sock delivery. - Sarah G.

These socks were perfect for the fourth! Surprised my boyfriend with a pair which he proudly sported all day. He received compliment after compliment on them which made both him and the socks feel super cool!! ;) - Amy

I signed my husband up for the Sock of the Month Club and he loves the socks! They're reasonably priced, they're fashionable, and he says he loves the way they feel. - Ashlin O.

Great variety in this set. Fun sock designs that can be worn almost anyplace. My husband loves all of them Thanks for a fun quality product! - Lina D.

They are great!  - Marie C.

Press

Although not nearly as important to us as what our customers say, Sock 101 also has received some great press over the last couple of years!

Forbes:  http://www.forbes.com/sites/johnhall/2013/06/10/5-gifts-that-keep-you-at-the-top-of-clients-minds/

Killer Startups:  http://www.killerstartups.com/rising-startup-stars/emerging-companies-sxsw/

KC Mag:  http://edition.pagesuite-professional.co.uk//launch.aspx?eid=9ad9b8fa-cb4f-4821-a40e-b2692544269f

Think Big Radio:  http://thinkbigkansascity.blogspot.com/2013/02/037-think-big-radio-jason-grill-of.html

1 Million Cups:  http://new.livestream.com/kauffmanfoundation/1MC111412

Entrepreneur KC Radio:  http://www.kmbz.com/topic/play_window.php?audioType=Episode&audioId=6141072

Recovering Politician:  http://therecoveringpolitician.com/contributors/jgrill/jason-grills-sock-101-gets-some-love-from-forbes-and-ghw-bush and http://therecoveringpolitician.com/contributors/jgrill/jason-grill-recovering-politician-turns-sockbroker

Kansas City Live:  http://www.kshb.com/dpp/entertainment/kcl/community_kcl/spring-shopping-event-for-a-great-cause

A Few FAQ’s

What are the women’s sizes?

Our sizes for our women’s line and women’s sock of the month club will be 5 - 10.

What is the composition of Sock 101’s?

The composition of the socks vary from style to style, but they are generally around 80% Cotton, 17% Nylon, and 3% Spandex.  They are designed to be a lightweight, yet strong blend between casual and dress sock that can be worn with a suit, pants, or jeans.  If you really want to be noticed, wear Sock 101’s with shorts!

How durable are Sock 101’s?

Unless you’re ridiculously hard on your socks or fail to manicure your nails on a regular basis, our socks hold up very well.  If you stay away from bleach, we have no reports of Sock 101 colors fading or bleeding.  

Where are your socks made?

Our socks are currently made in India.  We’ve developed a great relationship with our manufacturer over the last couple of years and they continue to make incredible socks at affordable prices.

Risks and Challenges

We’ve been designing and manufacturing socks now utilizing the same manufacturer for two years with very few glitches.  

However remote, the risks we face still comes down to our manufacturer’s ability to produce our designs and ship in a timely manner.  We could experience production, shipping, or customs delays in getting our orders.  

If we encounter any delays, we will be as transparent as possible.

Thank You!

As always, Sock 101 appreciates all of your support!

Sock on!

Lea Bailes, Jason Grill, Dave Feyerabend, and Kelly Yarborough

story:
Hi, my name is Gabi. 



I just started started my first year of cheerleading (GO HURRICANES!), and we have a lot of competition fees and uniform expenses. I've launched this online bake sale and jewelry sale (all made by me!) to raise the funds to pay those fees.

By backing this project, not only will you help me (Thank you so much!), you'll also get some really good treats - like:

Wookiee Cookiees



This is a recipe (not to be confused with the recipe in the Star Wars Cookbook) that my mom came up with in college. It's chocolate chip cookies with a cinnamon twist. She used to manage a bakery, and spent WAY too much time trying to come up with the perfect cookie. Get some Wookiee Cookiees and benefit from her misspent youth!

Note: These contain gluten, eggs, and milk

Oatmeal Raisin Cookies


This is NOT a recipe that my mom came up with, but they're still REALLY good. Try them out, and see for yourself!

Note: These also contain gluten, eggs, and milk

Chocolate Chip Banana Bread Mini-Loaves

This is another of my mother's crazy recipes. Banana bread with a generous helping of chocolate chips. Mmmmm. Give it a try!

Note: More gluten, eggs, and milk here

Note: Breads don't hold up that well in shipping, so this is only available to those who are local to us, who who know they'll be seeing us in the next few months (personal friends and family only). We will not be shipping any of the breads

Sugar-Free Honey Wheat Bread

If you want a healthy home-baked option, we have some sugar-free honey wheat bread. Toasted, with a little bit of butter, it's AMAZING.

Note: Contains gluten

Please see the note about shipping breads in the previous section.

Jewelry (Cultured Pearl Pendants and Hand-Made Beaded Bracelets)

I LOVE making jewelry, and this is your chance to have me make some jewelry for you. 

Have a sports team you support? Just really like a certain color? Just let me know what you want, and I'll make a beaded bracelet to fit your needs.

The cultured pearl pendants are not made by me, of course, but they are absolutely beautiful.

Note: Pendants sold without chains.

Conclusion

Thanks so much for taking the time to look through my page!

Please take a minute to look at the contribution levels to the right of the page, and don't forget to donate!

Final Note: We do not ship to international addresses. Shipping inside the US only.
story_txt:
Hi, my name is Gabi. I just started started my first year of cheerleading (GO HURRICANES!), and we have a lot of competition fees and uniform expenses. I've launched this online bake sale and jewelry sale (all made by me!) to raise the funds to pay those fees.By backing this project, not only will you help me (Thank you so much!), you'll also get some really good treats - like:Wookiee CookieesThis is a recipe (not to be confused with the recipe in the Star Wars Cookbook) that my mom came up with in college. It's chocolate chip cookies with a cinnamon twist. She used to manage a bakery, and spent WAY too much time trying to come up with the perfect cookie. Get some Wookiee Cookiees and benefit from her misspent youth!Note: These contain gluten, eggs, and milkOatmeal Raisin Cookies
This is NOT a recipe that my mom came up with, but they're still REALLY good. Try them out, and see for yourself!Note: These also contain gluten, eggs, and milkChocolate Chip Banana Bread Mini-LoavesThis is another of my mother's crazy recipes. Banana bread with a generous helping of chocolate chips. Mmmmm. Give it a try!Note: More gluten, eggs, and milk hereNote: Breads don't hold up that well in shipping, so this is only available to those who are local to us, who who know they'll be seeing us in the next few months (personal friends and family only). We will not be shipping any of the breadsSugar-Free Honey Wheat BreadIf you want a healthy home-baked option, we have some sugar-free honey wheat bread. Toasted, with a little bit of butter, it's AMAZING.Note: Contains glutenPlease see the note about shipping breads in the previous section.Jewelry (Cultured Pearl Pendants and Hand-Made Beaded Bracelets)I LOVE making jewelry, and this is your chance to have me make some jewelry for you. Have a sports team you support? Just really like a certain color? Just let me know what you want, and I'll make a beaded bracelet to fit your needs.The cultured pearl pendants are not made by me, of course, but they are absolutely beautiful.Note: Pendants sold without chains.ConclusionThanks so much for taking the time to look through my page!Please take a minute to look at the contribution levels to the right of the page, and don't forget to donate!Final Note: We do not ship to international addresses. Shipping inside the US only.

story:
In an anxiety-ridden moment in 2007 after having watched Al Gore's An Inconvenient Truth, a "lighthearted" documentary about the perils of climate change, I sought solace through Google.  I "Googled" terms I thought might light the way for me to get my hands dirty in the Green/Animal Rights Movement. I wanted the horrible feeling of helplessness (ie: "...humans, animals...we are all doomed...") I was experiencing to go away. 

So, I conducted more research while frantically twisting my hair, and engaged in some good old fashioned self-evaluation. I thought back to my college years when I had hand-sewed several bags using reclaimed denim shirts. That spark ignited a flame.

Pansy Maiden was born in the spring of 2009.  A year before, I had known very little about the “business” world and frankly, very little about designing and sewing bags. What I did know was that I wanted my life’s work to engage my creative tendencies, and to mean something to me.

At that time I was a “9-years-strong” vegetarian (now you can add “4-years-strong” vegan to that total) who decided that fashion + entrepreneurship would be my form of activism. My "ah-ha" moment came when I realized that I, with the help of my company, could spread positivity and possibly even inspire action in others.

  

Now I find myself in 2013 with an actual cruelty-free, eco-centric business (I'm a Business Lady?!). I have
developed a strong brand and gained a following via social networks in the vegan community as well as the creative communities of Boston. Pansy Maiden has been featured on popular websites such as Alicia Silverstone's The Kind Life Blog, GirlieGirlArmy, and Daily Candy. Two of my bags are currently on display in the latest sustainable design installation at Disney's Epcot Center. The demand for my products is growing exponentially. And I am still hand-making every single item in my home studio. Boutiques across the country would like to carry my line but I do not have time to supply their needs. Add my first child, due July 4th (!), to the mix and I'm quickly realizing that I simply cannot keep making every single Pansy Maiden/Alva DoRight bag with my own two hands.

 

The time has come to expand my brand, my reach, and my activist-fashion message far and wide. I need your support.

 

 

 

I need to raise $12,000 in order to hire six trusted seamstresses from one local sewing shop in Quincy, Massachusetts (thus keeping my bags locally handmade) to produce an initial inventory of 200 bags. The sales from this inventory will provide enough gross earnings for me to 1) reinvest in additional inventory, 2) provide myself an actual living wage and 3) free up some of my time for marketing efforts. Here is the breakdown of funds:

  • 27.5%: Materials for 200 bags 
  • 57.5%: Outside labor costs to make 200 bags
  • 8%: Marketing efforts
  • 7%: third party fees

If I reach my goal and my campaign has not expired, please don't let that stop you from donating :) $12,000 is actually a modest amount when it comes to working with outside sewers. With additional funds, I will be able to have even more bags made and that would be fan-tastic!

If I do not reach my goal of $12,000, I will adjust the number of bags I will have made via outside contracting accordingly. Your support will still be appreciated and used effectively and efficiently, but I do fear that 200 bags is the bare-minimum I will need outside seamstresses to produce in order to really move ahead in a manner that will ultimately be sustainable for my business. 

 

 

 

My undying love and appreciation for helping me build upon my dream of making a living while making the world a better place for all animals (and that includes humans--we are all animals, yes?) And perks. Many, many perks. 

I wanna show y'all how much I appreciate and honor your support with not only warm fuzzies, x's + o's, and good karma but also with extra amazing incentives. 

The $5 and $10 donation levels are pretty self-explanatory (and exciting, right?!) Just look to the column on the right to learn more about those.

NEW PERK! I'm working with Kristin from Will Travel for Vegan Food to hand out a WTF Vegan Food bumper sticker with every $10 donation. Just choose the *WTF Vegan Food Special* perk.
 

For all you crafty folks, I'll send you a stack of top-quality fat quarters (5 in all--22"x18") if you donate at the $25 level. Perfect for small projects. Fabric will be choosen at random by me. A fun surprise! Will contain a mix of patterns, solids, canvas, and quilting-weight. You non-crafty folks may be thinking, "But Laura, I don't need no fat quarters!" That's okay. I'm also offering a promo code for $40 off your next Pansy Maiden or Alva DoRight purchase (>$100) if you give me $25.

 

At the $50 level, I'm offering up my faux suede braclet made from material which is made from recycled plastic bottles. This bracelet features one piece of super-thick, super-soft, super-lux faux suede hand-cut into 1/4" strips. Handwashable! 

At the $100 and $150 level, I offer up my Canteen Pouch as seen above. The 1st pictures shows the kit you would get if you take one of my classes offered at the $150 level. The picture on the right shows the many possibilities a custom-fabric Canteen Pouch can provide at the $100 level. For more info, look to the column on the right.

 

The bag shown above is the brand new, limited edition, not-yet-offered-in-my-shop, Roadrunner Tote--Feminine version at the $250 level. It's water resistant and will take you from the Farmer's Market to a fun dinner out. For more info, look to the column on the right.

 

The bag shown above is the brand new, limited edition, not-yet-offered-in-my-shop Roadrunner Tote--Unisex version. It will come branded with the Alva DoRight label thus making this the VERY FIRST ALVA DoRIGHT BAG! This bag is water resistant inside and out as well as wipe-cleanable. It's being offered at the $250 level.  For more info, look to the column on the right.

For more info about the "Holy-Moly-Grand-Packages" I've put together at the $500 and $1000 level, look to the column on the right.

 

I only need an initial order of 200 bags so that I may spring-board my partnership with a local sewing shop. I hope to grow with them from there. I just need a nice starting point. As stated above, the sales from this initial inventory will provide enough gross earnings for me to reinvest in additional inventory, provide myself an actual living wage, and free up some of my time for marketing efforts. Your contribution will allow me to grow my brand into an even stronger, sustainable agent of change for the animals and our Earth by helping me to:

  • Provide enriching, enjoyable jobs to my local economy that will allow at least six other women to do what they love--something I have always dreamt of doing.
  • Rather than spending all my time sewing, I will have time to devote to building my activist brand. Less time sewing = more time to devote to marketing efforts, thus building and spreading my activist fashion message to a much wider, broader market.
  • Help to assure a smooth launch of my new men's collection, Alva DoRight, this summer. This one launch will expand my market by nearly 50%!
  • Move from a Made-to-Order model to an In-Stock/Ready-to-Ship model. My customers will no longer have to wait 2-3 weeks to receive their bags in the mail. I believe this will make people more apt to buy, thus increasing my revenues, thus making my cruelty-free brand more likely to succeed and inspire action in others.
  • Assure that I will always have a stock of bags so that I may participate in more pop-up shops and conventions around the country. This will help me build my brand and name recognition significantly.  
  • Allow me to have a life outside of Pansy Maiden so that I may, you know, help my husband raise our daughter.

 


I totally understand that some of you just can't give me your financial support at this time but...there are other ways you can help me out!

  • Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Please share my campaign with any person and/or organization you think might be interested in helping an cruelty-free sistah out.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools located towards the top of this page!

You guys are awesome!

story:
ALIAKIM is a fashion line that aims to create fashion forward "revolutionary chic" pieces that not only make you look great, but also make you feel great knowing that you've supported positive global initiatives.

For the last two years, we have made it our goal and ambition to bring the REBELLION to the RUNWAY, the COUP to the COUTURE, and the CARRIE BRADSHAW to the CAUSE.

That's how we run our revolution-  we use fashion to support organizations whose mission and efforts we respect. Therefore, a portion of the proceeds from each piece we create goes towards bringing someone else peace. Since our inception we have supported organizations like like the Gulf Coast Oil Relief Fund and Invisible Children.

This year, the revolution has us starting in India! This is where our second collection will be created. This collection is called ReInventing the Bush, and features original fabrics and accessories that meld war imagery with ones from nature. Therefore you can expect to see a butterfly with brass knuckle as wings, a grenade opening into a flower, and a tree with an AK-47 as its trunk. Please look under the Gallery tab above to see examples.

A portion of the proceeds from this collection will go to support organizations that support the rehabilitation of child soldiers, as well as their reintegration into mainstream society. These issues are very real problems in countries like Northern and Southern Sudan, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda.

This is where you come in! After a rigorous year of pop-up boutique openings and launches in New York, Miami and Jamaica- we are just short of our goal to produce the next line of original Aliakim pieces.

Your support will help us produce 5 signature dresses and a series of creative accessories. Part of the reason we are going to India is so that we can be more informed about the creative process AS WELL AS access all of the materials from their original sources. 

We would like to thank YOU- for the time you've taken just by watching our video. We look forward to collaborating with you to make this line the phenomenal movement its slated to be! Please share with your friends, families, and fellow fashionistas!

Because what you WEAR
can let the world know
how AWARE
you are.

story:
Hailey Allen Designs is a Greensboro, NC based business that is growing and has great potential. I am working on adding new and more personalized lines of jewelry, charms, and ornaments to my stock as well as greatly expanding the lines that are currently in my shop. All of my merchandise is handmade by me with a great amount of passion and care.

 

The Story

Hailey Allen Designs sprouted out of a hobby and a skill I picked up while earning my degree in interior architecture - wire and metal manipulation. Upon graduation I branched out and began making simple jewelry but, I wanted to do so much more. Wire and metal can get expensive and quality metals even more so. Thus, I am looking for help to expand my supplies, stock, and exposure while making this my career.

 

Being brilliantly accessorized doesn’t need to be expensive. My goal as a designer is to make beautiful and elegant jewelry that is also affordable to the average person. As of right now, most of my sales have been in person but I am looking to develop my online presence in addition to physical sales. I am asking for $5,000 to help fund the various aspects of my business listed below.

 

You Will Be Funding

  • Tools and materials for personalized stamped metal charms and jewelry.
  • Materials for precious metal wire bending/weaving.
  • Materials for ornaments which 20% of profits are donated to Camp Carefree, a summer camp for children with disabilities. www.campcarefree.org/
  • Materials for the expansion of current stock.
  • Marketing, promotion, and website development.

 

How You Can Help

Every little bit helps and I understand not everyone can donate. But you can still contribute by telling your friends, writing on your blog, and linking through your social networking outlets. Please use the share icons above to spread the word. You will have my infinite gratitude!

 

As I have said, any and all donations go a long way and to say thank you, I would like to give you a gift to show you my appreciation.

 

$1

Bronze Contributor

My sincerest thanks and a mention on my website as a contributor.

 

$10

Silver Contributor

A mention on my website as a contributor + a hand written thank you note.

 

$25

Gold Contributor

A mention on my website as a contributor + one pair of earrings of your choice from the gallery + a hand written thank you note.

 

$50

Platinum Contributor

A mention on my website as a contributor + one pair of earrings + one bracelet of your choice from the gallery + a hand written thank you note.

 

$75

Emerald Contributor

A mention on my website as a contributor + one pair of earrings + one bracelet + one necklace of your choice from the gallery + a hand written thank you note.

 

$100

Diamond Contributor

A mention on my website as a contributor + one pair of earrings + one bracelet + one necklace + one set of six ornaments of your choice from the gallery + a hand written thank you note.

 

For the contributors who qualify, you will be able to choose from five different styles of earrings in five different colors. Bracelets and necklaces both come in one style but can be made to match the colors of the earrings or you can mix it up and get a different color for each piece. The colors to select form are black, blue, burgundy, green, and mauve.

 

For contributors who qualify for the ornament set you can choose from three different styles and three different colors. You can mix and match these however you please. They come in white, grey-silver, and ivory.

 

Stay Connected

To stay updated on the progress of this campaign and to see me through my journey, you can follow me on my website, Facebook, and Twitter.

 

http://www.haileyallendesigns.com

https://www.facebook.com/HaileyAllenDesigns

https://twitter.com/HaileyADesigns

 

Cheers!

-Hailey

story:
About Us

From designer hopefuls to ambitious photographers, hungry stylists to determined models, everyone's looking to get a piece of the fashion world.  Our aim is to bring the stage to these artistic hopefuls in order to garner them the exposure needed to inspire and cultivate creativity in their field.

Why Houston?  Will We Expand?

Houston is a city full of starving artists. Unfortunately, this major metropolis bears a stigma known all too well: industrialism.  Because of our thriving refineries and multi-billion dollar companies, people tend to overlook the creativity this city has birthed.  From Montrose's art society to our museum and theatre districts, Houston is full of creativity.
 
Our longterm goals consists of taking this platform and establishing the magazine in various US cities (i.e. The Look-Austin, The Look-Denver, etc).

Why We Need Your Help

In order to launch this first issue, we need your help!  Most of the print publishers have notified us that it will take a MINIMUM of $6,000 in order to print 10,000 copies of our magazine for our first run.  Of course, the more we make, the more we can print!
 
In addition to offering the magazine in print form, we will also be showcasing a brand new website to accompany it.  In order to do this, we will need to be able to fund the development of our website and pay for yearly hosting management.

How Far Can My Dollar Go?

Your dollar can make a difference.  That single dollar can be the difference between missing our goal ($24,999) or just passing it ($25,001).  To put this into perspective, imagine if everyone on our Facebook friends list combined with your Facebook friends list, combined with your friends' Facebook friends list, donated $1, well, you get the point...we'd EASILY fund this project.

You Will Be Recognized

We're offering rewards and perks (listed to the right).  This means we will bestow rewards and recognition upon you for your generosity, even if you only donated $1.  Why?  Because we know that without you, publishing this first issue won't be possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can help spread the word.  Facebook is a great medium to help get the word out to your friends and family.  You never know, someone you know may enjoy fashion as much as we do and decide to contribute.  BAM!  That means you've just contributed!
story_txt:
About Us
From designer hopefuls to ambitious photographers, hungry stylists to determined models, everyone's looking to get a piece of the fashion world.  Our aim is to bring the stage to these artistic hopefuls in order to garner them the exposure needed to inspire and cultivate creativity in their field.
Why Houston?  Will We Expand?

Unfortunately, this major metropolis bears a stigma known all too well: industrialism.  Because of our thriving refineries and multi-billion dollar companies, people tend to overlook the creativity this city has birthed.  From Montrose's art society to our museum and theatre districts, Houston is full of creativity.
