story:
What people are saying about us:

 "A revelation in a market begging for innovation."

 "A chance to be yourself, and be creative, everyday."

 "The power to change your look everyday."

 "Changing the way you will wear sunglasses."

 "Upgrade your style with a pair from UNIQBROW"

 "Change your frames as often as your underwear."

 

Everyday we left home wearing the same pair of glasses despite changing every other aspect of our look, it was driving us mad!  So one day we trudged over to our boss's corner office busted open the window ripped open our shirts and screamed "I'm mad as hell, and I'm not gonna take it anymore!" We bailed on our day jobs and for the past year we have poured our hearts into one common goal: give people the ability to have a unique pair of glasses everyday, designed and manufactured to the highest quality.  

With one pair of our lenses you will be able to remove them and insert them into every pair of UNIQBROW frames.

 

 

We are starting with three models, each with a collection of 12 vibrant colors.  

 

  

We have built a really cool internal structure that fits across all the models, and allows you to fit the same pair of frames into all the lenses.

 

  

Removing and inserting the lenses is as easy as putting on your socks....or tying your shoes for those in the anti-sock camp.  See the demo here

 

 

We are not just about colors, we have worked to create innovative new designs that reinvent classic looks.  Our collection is a marriage of retro, with our own personal re-imagining of how they can fit into the modern society of 2013.  You won’t need a flying Delorean for this back to the future experience, but you will need a credit card to ride this train.   



You can see the 219 sit perfectly on the bridge of the nose, and dogs love them too!

 

The 219 isn’t just for the young, grandmas love these babies, and the 518 looks stylish even when you are cleaning fish at the market...

 

 

Or if you are looking to do some skateboarding, the 518 has a firm hold to stay on your face even when you are bailing on a sick 180 BS Noseslide.

 

 

The 948 looks totally sweet on the raddest hipsters...

 

 

Or the 948 can be tailored to match your beard color 

 

Our branded case, boxes, micro-fiber towels, and pouches that will come with every pair! 

To see more details about the collection check out http://www.uniqbrow.com/pages/collection

 

 

We have worked incredibly hard to do everything from design to production here in our hometown of Barcelona, and with our small team of three people.

  • Produced the prototypes you have seen modeled above
  • Designed branded packaging including: cases, pouches, cleaning clothes, and boxes
  • Sourced raw materials and colors from local distributors
  • Partnered with a Barcelona manufacturer to create the mold and the frames
  • Partnered with the most trusted lenses manufacturer, Optics by Carl Zeiss
  • Received pre-orders from boutiques in Barcelona
  • Completed our website

 

 

 

Mid February: Complete first molds
End of February: Begin test productions
Beginning of March: Open uniqbrow.com for pre-orders
Mid-March: If we are funded, begin production run in Terrassa (just outside Barcelona)
Mid-March: Produce packaging, cases, and micro-fiber towels in Barcelona
Beginning of April: Indiegogo backers become the first faces on the planet to wear UNIQBROWs!
End of 2013: The largest glasses manufacturers in the world begin shutting their doors in fear!

 

 

We need your money to accomplish our next steps: 

  • Finish the molds for all three models
  • Accomplish our first real production run
  • Expand our color offering
  • Complete the packaging
  • Set up our logistics and distribution channels in the US

Our team has lived and breathed eyewear for the past year, we have extensive experience in design, production, and retail operations.  We are well positioned to make this a very real competitor within the eyewear industry.  The only thing we lack is a crazy rich uncle, we need you to be that crazy rich uncle.

 

 

We are offering our backers a chance to get our glasses at a discounted price.  Everyone who is rewarded a pair will get to select the model and color that your glasses will come in.  We have also made a really cool limited edition pair of glasses that will come in the higher priced packs.  You will be one of the few people on the planet wearing these bad boys! 

 

We are offering you some really cool postcards from Barcelona that we made like the one you see above.

 

Also, we have the above autographed posters from the UNIQBROW team that will go awesome in your bedroom!

 

 

 

Don’t have money to donate?  Join the club, why do you think we are here!  Thank you for donating your time to read all of this, you must be really bored at work right now.  

If you can’t offer financial help you can  still do us a huge favor.  Please go to uniqbrow.com and sign up for our newsletter so we can keep in touch like old friends.  Someday maybe you will have some extra cash and want to buy a new pair of glasses (or three).  Also, at the top of this page are some buttons that allow you to share on twitter and facebook, at the bottom of this page are links to OUR twitter and facebook (hint: follow us already, I thought we were good friends!).  Thank you so much for being a believer in our project, and our team!

 

 

Sorry we forgot to introduce ourselves, how rude!

 

   Cristina Brossa: Cris spent six years working in audio visual production at the CCCB (look it up, they do radical exhibitions).  She has a master in Fine Arts, graphic design, and audio visual production.  She has also been a freelance graphic designer for way too long, and wants to get out of the game.  Since meeting a handsome American on a beach in Croatia during a vacation in 2010 she has spent time working for museums in San Francisco, and building UNIQBROW.  She has two grandmas that are 90 years old, both have more energy than a 12 year old kid.



   Mireia Subirana: Mireia also spent several years working for the CCCB, mainly preparing coffees for her boss. She now has a masters in coffee making.  Ok, she also has real credentials as well.  Mireia spent several years working as a freelance doing interaction design and audio visual production. She has a masters in graphic and digital design and a postgraduate in exhibition design.  Her love of new media art blossomed after she spent time living in some eccentric corners of Berlin.  She also created the worlds largest game of pong that was projected across The Ramblas in Barcelona.



   Andrew Swiler: Spent several years as a consultant working for retail companies.  He got fed up and traveled in 2010 where he met a young woman from Barcelona on a beach in Croatia.  His life has been pretty strange ever since.  He spent time working for startups in San Francisco, built his own startup company in Barcelona that was a colossal flame out, and lost his hair (though that was likely a genetic defect).    

Thank you! (In 3 languages)

Estem molt agraïts a tots aquells que ens heu donat suport en la nostra campanya! Les vostres amables paraules sobre el nostre projecte han estat encoratjadores! 

Agraïm a tots aquells que heu comprat ulleres, però també volem agraïr la col·laboració d'aquells que han posat de 5 a 25 dollars / euros a canvi de postals i pósters, perquè ens ajuda molt i molt! 
Gràcies a tots vosaltres UNIQBROW serà possible!
 
Estamos muy agradecidos a todos aquellos que nos haveis dado soporte en nuestra campaña! Vuestras palabras amables sobre nuestro proyecto han estado muy alentadoras!
Agradecemos a todos aquellos que habéis comprado las gafas, pero también queremos agradecer la colaboración de aquellos que han puesto de 5 a 25 dólares o euros, a cambio de postales, pósters, pues nos ayuda muchísimo!
Gracias a todos vosotros UNIQBROW será posible!
 
We are so thankful for all of you who have backed us and visited the campaign!  Your kind words about our project have been amazing!
We thank all of you who have bought a pair of glasses, but we also want to thank to all those one who have collaborated giving $5 to $25 dollars, for postcards, posters in exchange, because those are the donations that will make a huge difference!
Thank's to all of you UNIQBROW will be possible!

 

 

 

1.) Can I use perscription lenses with my new UNIQBROWs?

You absolutely can!  Take our frames and lenses to any optician with your perscritpion and they will produce you a pair of perscription lenses like any other pair of glasses.

2.) Can I wear non sunlenses?

Of course, but legally we have to remind you that if you are going to be in the sun, you should wear sun lenses.  Your mom would be proud of us for reminding you.  

3.) Is the whole frame flexible?

We designed the glasses to have a strong structure that will give you the solid fit you are used to. Our innovative soft material for the external finish will give you incredible soft comfort on your face.

4.) After I buy my first pair, how do I get more?

We are going to start selling online in Spain and the US with free delivery.  We will then be selling in shops througout Europe, you will find the locations on our website, and updated regularly.  Or shoot us an email and we can see how we can get some more UNIQBROWs to you.

5.) Will you have a warranty?

Yes!  Our glasses are built with quality, but we guaranty any manufacturer defects returned to us within 24 months will be replaced. 

6.) What is your return policy?

Unfortunately for our Indiegogo campaign we do not allow returns unless they are under the terms of the warranty.  In which case we will replace any glasses that have a manufacturer defect for the first 24 months you own the glasses.  For purchases through our website we will offer 30 day no hassle returns though!  Check out uniqbrow.com for more info.

7.) When I change lenses between frames, how do I keep them clean?

With every pair of UNIQBROW frames you get a super cool microfiber cloth with the UNIQBROW logo.  We recommend when you are taking out or inserting the lenses you use this cloth.  Or if you don't, you can use the cloth afterwards to clean the lenses as good as new!  Lenses and frames can be cleaned with luke warm water and non-aggressive detergent.

8.) Optics by Carl Zeiss Vision lenses sound pretty awesome, do you have more info?

We were focused on making every aspect of UNIQBROWs high quality, from frames to lenses. Carl Zeiss Vision manufactures the highest quality lenses with the most thorough UV protection testing in the industry.  We promise these are the best lenses around!

9.)  What is the sizing for the glasses?

Below are the models and their sizing up close! 

Below you can see the model prototypes in order:



 

Our 219 model, inspired by the classic cat eyes design made famous by Audrey Hepburn in Breakfast at Tiffany’s (a movie that plays 24 hours a day here in Spain).  

 

 

The 518 model  was our way of redefining the classic Wayfarer that has become popular the past few years, a style from the 60’ transported to 2013.

 

 

The 948 model is a remix of the square broadside sunglasses that were popular in the sixties and seventies, we have reinvented them because we felt it was a style begging to be brought back.

story:
Study Abroad is expensive, and I need YOUR help to get to Florence! It's my dream to study fashion design in Italy, and it would mean so much to me if you can help make it happen!  

My tuition is $3200 so ANYTHING you can give would be greatly appreciated!
story_txt:
Study Abroad is expensive, and I need YOUR help to get to Florence! It's my dream to study fashion design in Italy, and it would mean so much to me if you can help make it happen!  
My tuition is $3200 so ANYTHING you can give would be greatly appreciated!

story:
http://www.lasso-shoes.com/

My name is Gaspard Tiné-Berès, I'm a product designer graduated from royal college of Art in London, you can see my work here

I've designed these slippers one year ago and I would like to put them in the market for next winter. I've already invested in the tools, and set a team of partners and suppliers; the felt is 100% pure wool felt made in Germany, the laces are made in France and the shoes itself will be made in a social workshop next to Paris. As you can see it's all ready to go, I just need some little help to buy the first roll of material and get me starting.

What I Need & What You Get

I need 7500$ to pay for the wool felt, the leather, the man-work and the packaging, 7500$ should be enough to make the first 500 pairs.

If you buy a pair now you will get the limited first edition which will be specially numbered and signed.

The Impact

The slippers will be made by a social enterprise based next to Paris which hires handicapped people. Getting involved in this project would help them and me running on a sustainable business.

Other ways you Can Help

If you can't contribute or you already have too many pairs of slippers you can still talk about it to your friends!

story:
Still looking to donate, read more about the project or follow our Journey? Head on over to www.projectstitch.org , we'll see you there!



Who is Enactus Memorial...and What is Project Stitch?


Enactus Memorial is an award-winning student volunteer organization based out of Memorial University of Newfoundland. We strive to improve the quality of life and standard of living of those who need it most.

In August  2013, we joined forces with Project Founders Dr. Joanna Cherry and Scott Gillenwater to expand a project with already astonishing potential. Project Stitch is an early-stage program that has a huge opportunity to drastically change lives while enriching the economy in a post-disaster society.



Our Product!


Project Stitch creates beautiful handmade products of the highest quality. While we have a social side to our initiative, our goal is to make incredible products that our customers are excited to wear.


Our first product line is men’s neck ties. These ties come in two materials: a bold cotton with Haitian flare and a professional silk. Each tie comes embroidered with the Project Stitch logo on the back, a branded cloth carrying bag and a story card explaining the importance of Project Stitch and the story of the sewer who made your tie.


We are excited to be making these ties and we hope you enjoy wearing them as much as we enjoy making them! Remember, each handmade garment tells a story, so whether you’re heading to a wedding, conference or business meeting, let your outfit look its best while keeping Haiti close to your heart. 


The Program!


Project stitch is a Trade Training  and employment enrichment program based out of Port-au-Prince, Haiti. In a developed country, a disability can be very isolating, but in Haiti, these people become completely cut off from the world around them. Project Stitch allows Haitians who have suffered these life-changing injuries from the devastating 2010 earthquake or due to the danger of everyday life in Haiti, to reintegrate, and become a productive member of their local community.



Through a six-month professional sewing course, these individuals are taught the necessary skills to become tailors and seamstresses. Once their training is completed, they are ready to re-enter the workforce, and we are now working on creating a brand for our co-operative starting with high quality men’s neckties and pocket squares.

We need your support to help us move into a new facility and to acquire the materials and supplies necessary to move our venture into full scale production.

Why $31,000?


Project stitch is currently being run from a small room in Hospital Bernard Mevs. This is just across the hall from where many of the program’s participants spent so much time in recovery from their injuries. This room, no larger than a bedroom in your home, can hold approximately ten participants, and currently the most experienced of them are working on production of the ties.

We are now looking for capital to move our tie production team into a full-scale production facility which will allow us to use our space at Hospital Bernard Mevs to train more Haitians in need. We have a new location selected, but it is in no way ready to be moved into. We need $20,000 for new building expenses, rent, renovations and a generator. We are also in need of $11,000 for supplies and equipment to start production and to push our next two underprivileged classes through the program. Any extra funds will help us increase our working space and train more Haitians in the field. Enactus Memorial is 100% not-for-profit. That means that every cent of revenue from the sale of the neckties and this crowd sourcing campaign will go directly to develop the program and supporting the participants. 

We are working with many designs and alongside industry professionals in men’s apparel to nail down the final product. We have figured out the perfect offset and location for the rear logo and the colors which would best complement it.  Everything from the width, weight, length ,stitching, materials and all the other factors which make up Project Stitch ties have been considered. Our cotton patterned cotton ties will turn heads and pull together any outfit for the perfect amount of flare. Our silk ties are the perfect accessory to tap into your professionalism while creating the perfect conversation piece when entertaining a crowd.


We welcome any funds invested into this social enterprise.  Even if we do not reach our goal  your contributions will still help us  move classes throughout the program and source materials which will help us build our brand and move toward securing a national retailer to carry our ties. 

Check out this short video to see a day at project stitch!


Brace for Your Impact!

Project Stitch provides each participant with training, their own personal sewing machine, materials and transportation; we plan to train a new class every six months. We will only create employment for those Haitians who need it, so all  sewing instructors and employees of Project Stitch are native Haitians.

When making your donation, remember that you are enriching the lives of people who have been through so much, and they deserve a chance at forging a new career for themselves and reintegrating themselves into society.


Will you help move a participant and their family off the street living in a tent, to a home?

Will you help stop a Hatian from staring at the ceiling from their hospital bed knowing they’ll  never support their families again?

Will you bring a person the joy of knowing they are supporting their community after so much has happened to their people?

Enactus Memorial is now involved in ten  successful community involvement projects in Canada but we are looking to make an international impact. We need your support to make it a reality.  

Hey Stitch, How Else Can I Help?

Share, Share, Share!


If you believe in this initiative please share this page with anybody who you think would share the same interest. Share with your family, share with your friends, share it throughout the office and share it on your social media sites!We are also still looking for a major corporate partner. If you are or know of any company who would be interested in this social venture, please share this with them or forward them our  contact information. We are open and flexible to various partnership options and have a sponsorship package ready to send you!

Follow us on twitter for daily updates! @ProjStitchHaiti

And on our website www.projectstitch.org

Project Founders Dr. Joanna Cherry and Scott Gillenwater
story_txt:
Still looking to donate, read more about the project or follow our Journey? Head on over to www.projectstitch.org , we'll see you there!



Who is Enactus Memorial...and What is Project Stitch?Enactus Memorial is an award-winning student volunteer organization based out of Memorial University of Newfoundland. We strive to improve the quality of life and standard of living of those who need it most.In August  2013, we joined forces with Project Founders Dr. Joanna Cherry and Scott Gillenwater to expand a project with already astonishing potential. Project Stitch is an early-stage program that has a huge opportunity to drastically change lives while enriching the economy in a post-disaster society. 
Our Product!
Project Stitch creates beautiful handmade products of the highest quality. While we have a social side to our initiative, our goal is to make incredible products that our customers are excited to wear. Our first product line is men’s neck ties. These ties come in two materials: a bold cotton with Haitian flare and a professional silk. Each tie comes embroidered with the Project Stitch logo on the back, a branded cloth carrying bag and a story card explaining the importance of Project Stitch and the story of the sewer who made your tie. We are excited to be making these ties and we hope you enjoy wearing them as much as we enjoy making them! Remember, each handmade garment tells a story, so whether you’re heading to a wedding, conference or business meeting, let your outfit look its best while keeping Haiti close to your heart. The Program!Project stitch is a Trade Training  and employment enrichment program based out of Port-au-Prince, Haiti. In a developed country, a disability can be very isolating, but in Haiti, these people become completely cut off from the world around them. Project Stitch allows Haitians who have suffered these life-changing injuries from the devastating 2010 earthquake or due to the danger of everyday life in Haiti, to reintegrate, and become a productive member of their local community. Through a six-month professional sewing course, these individuals are taught the necessary skills to become tailors and seamstresses. Once their training is completed, they are ready to re-enter the workforce, and we are now working on creating a brand for our co-operative starting with high quality men’s neckties and pocket squares. We need your support to help us move into a new facility and to acquire the materials and supplies necessary to move our venture into full scale production.Why $31,000?Project stitch is currently being run from a small room in Hospital Bernard Mevs. This is just across the hall from where many of the program’s participants spent so much time in recovery from their injuries. Any extra funds will help us increase our working space and train more Haitians in the field. Enactus Memorial is 100% not-for-profit. That means that every cent of revenue from the sale of the neckties and this crowd sourcing campaign will go directly to develop the program and supporting the participants. We are working with many designs and alongside industry professionals in men’s apparel to nail down the final product. We have figured out the perfect offset and location for the rear logo and the colors which would best complement it.  Everything from the width, weight, length ,stitching, materials and all the other factors which make up Project Stitch ties have been considered. Our cotton patterned cotton ties will turn heads and pull together any outfit for the perfect amount of flare. Our silk ties are the perfect accessory to tap into your professionalism while creating the perfect conversation piece when entertaining a crowd. We welcome any funds invested into this social enterprise.  Even if we do not reach our goal  your contributions will still help us  move classes throughout the program and source materials which will help us build our brand and move toward securing a national retailer to carry our ties. Check out this short video to see a day at project stitch!Brace for Your Impact!Project Stitch provides each participant with training, their own personal sewing machine, materials and transportation; we plan to train a new class every six months. We will only create employment for those Haitians who need it, so all  sewing instructors and employees of Project Stitch are native Haitians.When making your donation, remember that you are enriching the lives of people who have been through so much, and they deserve a chance at forging a new career for themselves and reintegrating themselves into society. Share with your family, share with your friends, share it throughout the office and share it on your social media sites!We are also still looking for a major corporate partner. If you are or know of any company who would be interested in this social venture, please share this with them or forward them our  contact information. story:
Hi,

My name is Stephanie Goerlach.

I have recently completed an Advanced Diploma in Fashion Design at Ultimo Tafe Fashion Design Studio.  Based on my graduating range â€œALICE IN WONDERâ€ I have been selected to show a twelve piece collection from my label â€œTIBBITYâ€ at Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia 2012.

 The New Innovators show is presented annually by Ultimo Tafe and provides an amazing opportunity for highly talented newcomers to showcase their designs in front of Australiaâ€™s leading industry professionals and international media.

This incredibly anticipated show has been dubbed as an insight into the future of Australian fashion. With previous shows unveiling some of the most well renowned designers that Australia has to offer. Names such as Dion Lee, Nicky Zimmerman, Akira Isogawa, Alex Perry & Lisa Ho have all passed through the doors of the Sydney Fashion Design Studio and shot into fame.  So needless to say â€“ this is an amazing opportunity!

As I am sure you can appreciate, the design and production of a collection such as this is a time consuming and expensive process, which requires incredible dedication and attention to detail. To date I have funded the production of my collection entirely independently - working insanely long hours in between endless assignments and sleepless nights of printing, sewing, and hand embellishing.  With only months remaining to deliver my entire range I need to put 100% of my time into its completion.

Through sponsorship contributions I am hoping to raise approximately $10,000 by the end of April.  This money will enable me to complete the 7 looks I have left to produce, accessorise the collection, design & set up a web site for my label and shoot the look book for the entire range.  I am currently approaching reputable industry leaders and the general public for contributions of any amount to help to cover these expenses and make the launch of this collection possible.

Where your support will go:

  • $2000 for sewing supplies, fabrics & yarns
  • $2000 for specialized machine knitting (my mum is knitting the rest)
  • $2000 to digitally print my fabrics
  • $1500 for specialized machinist help (I will sew most of it myself but need help with the finer details)
  • $1500 for shoes, accessories, etc
  • $1000 to shoot and print a professional look book, photographer, makeup artist, printing etc


Remember, no contribution is too small!!

All donations will be greatly appreciated and go directly to the launch of my label â€˜TIBBITYâ€™.

Contributions can be paid via PAYPAL using the following details:

Name: Stephanie Goerlach
Email: stephaniegoerlach@gmail.com

If you have any further questions please email me


With my sincerest gratitude and forever thanks.  

Steph x

story:
TWO SISTERS...

Genetic Dreams is a T-shirt Brand Inspired by Me (Tiffany Hughes) and my sister Candace Hughes.  It’s a brand that was developed because we are both enthusiast, when it comes to street-wear and urban fashion.

  We came up with the name Genetic Dreams for a few reasons

  1. I and my sister share the same genetics.
  2. We both made a commitment to never stop pursing our dreams…

However Genetic Dreams has so many different meanings, it is all in your perspective. I want everyone to see themselves in Our brand. It is about a connection, a bond, a strain that is unbreakable; It doesn’t have to be genetics ,but that incredible friendship, or devoted family or strong community, that support your dreamS. Genetic Dreams can also be that empowerment, regardless of who your family is, they do not determine who you are,

YOU make your own destinies and live out your own dreams.

 

Our vision

We will use the money for several different reasons

  1. Producing and Creating more great designs and T-shirts
  2. Advertising, reaching out to as many people as we can, flyers, magazines newspapers, free gear, etc.
  3. Event planning such as community outreach programs and a variety of trade shows.

Every single donation counts, we want YOU to be a part of making our t-shirt brand come to life.

IF YOU CAN NOT DONATE,PLEASE SPREAD OUR BRAND ON FACEBOOK, TWITTER, AND INSTAGRAM, ANY, LOVE YOU SHOW US WILL BE HUMBLY APPRECIATED. 

 

Genetic Perks

T-shirt Perks,

  • If you Dontate $25 and up you will receive a type or types of Genetic Dream's T-shirts.

  • You will find all the t-shirts on our gallery page, the shirts are in order and correspond with the type of Perk you purchased.

  • All t-shirts come in small thru xxxl,tanks come in a small thru xxl.

  • If you Purchase the Limited Edition Perk you can request any size and design that is on our gallery page. if you choose the "In the Clouds" design you have the choice of a t-shirt or tank.

  • If you purchased the Limited Edition Perk we will send you several emails pretaining to the Limited Edition Shirts and snapbacks.

  • For The Two Shirt package you can choose 3 different designs and serveral colorways. You also have a choice between the Genetic Dreams logo tank. if you are not sure about the layout of the gallery please email and we will help sort out any misunderstandings. 

  • Genetic Dreams is here for you any questions, concerns or comments please shoot us a emai.... we are here to stay connected.

story:
Why Chillershades are saving the world

Meet Michael. He's a 15 year old high-school allstar living in San Francisco. Three years ago, YMCA matched Michael with a Santa Monica native, Jonah. The day they met, Michael shared his dream that he would some day be able to go to college and eventually become an entrepreneur. Today, ChillerShades are here to make that happen -- and of course, to make your day brighter along the way.

Brighter, you say?

We set out to rethink a product that's a part of almost everyone's day and designed these sunglasses to be exactly what you need no matter where you are or what you're doing. 

When you're kickin' it on a beautiful sunny day, they're super high quality sunglasses that protect your eyes by shading them. When you're rocking out in the shade or indoors, there's no need to sacrifice your look: Chillershades use advanced photochromic technology to give your view a chill bright so you won't have to take them off to see, no matter how dark it gets. Made of the highest quality wooden frames, super robust aluminum hinges, and clear photochromic lenses that protect your eyes both in the sun and in the shade, we've got you covered from sunrise to...sunrise. We're pretty sure you'll never take them off.

Here's how it works

You pre-order these sunglasses and save 20% off the retail price for being an early supporter. You get some ridiculously amazing Chillershades in the mail (guaranteed to become your favorite possession) and all profits go to send Michael to college. 

Make the bright decision

Buy some Chillershades. And don't worry if you can't donate - promote the campaign on Facebook/Twitter/Instagram. And that’s all there is to it.

- Michael and Jonah


Sandalwood Ices

Kosso Ices

Bamboo Ices

No need to choose which ones you want now - we'll email you closer to the shipment date and ask.

story:
Keep up to date with yarness at yarness.me. Thank you to everyone who contributed to make it happen for us. We are so overwhelmed with gratitude and excitement for the future!!!


As Seen on:

   

 

 


Our Goal:

To set up a big human machine to create Yarnesses, a cute fashionable take on fetish wear.


The story behind Yarness

Hi I'm Ryan.

I moved to San Francisco to study Human Sexuality in 2004. A big part of SF gay culture is leather and fetish street fairs such as Folsom and Dore Alley. I enjoyed the fun and sexy nature of these street fairs and liked how the leather harnesses looked on the people around me. What I also noticed was a good chunk of people just enjoyed dressing up in harnesses and fetish gear without actually intending to use the garments for sexual purposes. I saw fashion accessories and my mind started buzzing. Around this time I learned to crochet.

In 2009 I crocheted a soft pink harness and wore it to Folsom. The harness got an immediate, strong and positive reaction, people took pictures, and I was hooked (crochet pun intended). Each year after, I produced another crocheted harness. I experimented with different styles and colors (including a jock strap). I amassed a good number of these harnesses, and I realized that I was designing a fashion line. 

Fast forward to now, and I’ve assembled a team to make a go of this. We named the dang things, and narrowed our line down to three Yarness styles (for now); we’ve fine-tuned designs, sourced yarn, figured out marketing and developed a production model to pay crafters for their time (see below for more details on that).

Yarness is fetish and fashion, and most of all fun. We hope you enjoy them as much as we do!




THE PERKS


The Hater Tee ($25) - added 7/10

Now you can take your snark offline, or support your love for Yarness! No one will ever know!


The Folsom Splash ($20) - added 7/9

We are planning to make a giant splash at Folsom Street Fair on Sunday, September 21, 2014. We want to make the biggest, most amazing Yarness event yet, and we'd love to get your ideas and have your input. If you donate at this perk level you'll have an opportunity to work with us to design our Folsom presence, you'll help defray the costs of yarn, hardware, models, social media exposure and anything else it takes to build this soft-fetishy work of art. You'll also be contributing to the fun, creative, quirky and artistic spirt of Yarness.


The Lock ($75) - added 7/8

Yarn Jewelry. Yup. We’ve transformed that s/m symbol of a master/slave relationship, the chain and padlock, and turned it into the softest, cutest necklace this side of the Folsom Street Fair.


The 3 Yarness Designs ($80)

The Classic is the fundamental Yarness, a simple but effective "X" across the chest and back.


The Bulldog Yarness crosses your chest and back, rests high on your body and draws attention to your chest. A good choice for broad fellows.


The Trucker Yarness goes around your shoulders and crosses in back, then attaches to your front belt loops. OMG it holds up pants like suspenders! 


Yarness All-over Tee (Custom Tee Perk) ($65)

It's like you are wearing Yarness but you are wearing a t-shirt. It's thrilling, we promise. These shirts are printed using dye sublimation to allow for full frontal action. Choose from from the below designs and we plan to add additional designs later. 

DIY Yarness Kit, make a Yarness yourself! ($29)

We will send you everything you need to make your own Yarness including the a pattern for the style of your choice, a crochet hook, the yarn, adjusters and rings. You will also have access to a Google Hangout with  Ryan  where he will teach you how to crochet. There will be 5 scheduled hangouts for you to choose from. 


Yarness Tank ($39)

A comfy tank from American Apparel that allows you to rock your Yarness persuasion. Sizes XS - XL available.


Custom Yarness ($222)

You and the Yarness team design a Yarness just for you. We'll figure out a design and then make it. It will be one-of-a-kind and unforgettable. Let's talk.


Yarn(ess)Bomb ($1234)

We are prepared to yarnbomb something of your choosing in San Francisco with a mega crochet creation. Don't you worry, we will document the creation and installation of the piece extensively on social media. Your idea must be able to be crocheted in under 25 hours and be feasible to install IRL. 


Yarness San Francisco Adventure ($2500)

We want to welcome you to our beautiful city and make you a one-of-a-kind Yarness. 

You get:

  • Roundtrip tickets to San Francisco (domestic flights only, we decide on a date together and we book it)
  • 1 night stay in San Francisco
  • Fun night on the town with the Yarness crew
  • Personal measurement session
  • Custom Yarness designed and made just for you


FAQ

Don't these Yarnesses stretch?

Yarnesses are made to fit tightly to your body. When you first wear them they will be snug, then stretch a bit as the knots sit into themselves. We incorporate this into our measurements. 

Additionally, each Yarness has adjustable sliders, so you are able to tighten the garment as much as you would like. 

A Yarness is not a leather harness, and should not be expected to behave as such. But trust us, you can pull on them, play with them and they are not going to break anytime soon.

How should I wear a Yarness?

You can wear a Yarness tight on your skin like a fetish garment or over your clothing as a accessory. A Yarness can dress up a outfit, especially if you pick a color that pops.

Do Yarnesses behave like leather harnesses?

Yarnesses are inspired by leather harnesses, but while light, durable and fun,  they are something else entirely. But don't worry, you can play with a yarness just like you would a harness. Did we just blow your mind?

When can I expect my Yarness? 

Depending on the size of this campaign we will produce yarnesses on a first come, first serve basis. We guarantee an end-of-year delivery for Yarnesses, but if you want your Yarness now we have the special "InstaYarness" order option. 

Do you ship internationally? 

We do, but for an additional amount for shipping. After you make your order, we will follow up with you with the additional cost.

How do I order the Yarness? 

Place your order on Indiegogo, and once the crowdfunding campaign has finished, we will direct you to an online form where you can indicate your style, color, and sizing preferences.


The Yarn


We are using Universal Yarn, a anti-pilling acrylic yarn that has a solid hold and a great selection of bright colors. Yarnesses are vegan. 


How are Yarnesses made?

Our production model recycles money back into the hands of local skilled crafters. We have a team of crocheters and we pay them a fair wage for their time making Yarnesses. We could have outsourced production, but we are committed to supporting local makers for work that they rarely get paid for. 

The price of a Yarness includes the cost of our manufacturing model. You are buying a US-made handcrafted good. 

If you are interested in becoming a maker, please visit: http://yarness.me/make/


Why Crowdfunding?

After wearing Yarnesses for years, countless people have asked where to buy one. This is only anecdotal evidence, and without any large investors in the project we decided to crowdfund Yarness to help us:

1. Gauge demand - How many people actually want this? Doing this campaign will help us understand the scale of the project.

2. Build capital - The money we make with this campaign will help us buy supplies/inventory, pay makers and market the product.

3. Establish urgency - Look, we could go open an Etsy store but that's hard to get the word out about. With only 43 days to purchase a Yarness we are hoping to gather all orders at once to make production a lot more manageable.


Any other questions? Email us at info@yarness.me


From Ryan and Brian, thanks!
story_txt:
Keep up to date with yarness at yarness.me. Thank you to everyone who contributed to make it happen for us. We are so overwhelmed with gratitude and excitement for the future!!!As Seen on:     Our Goal:To set up a big human machine to create Yarnesses, a cute fashionable take on fetish wear.The story behind Yarness
Hi I'm Ryan.I moved to San Francisco to study Human Sexuality in 2004. A big part of SF gay culture is leather and fetish street fairs such as Folsom and Dore Alley. I enjoyed the fun and sexy nature of these street fairs and liked how the leather harnesses looked on the people around me. What I also noticed was a good chunk of people just enjoyed dressing up in harnesses and fetish gear without actually intending to use the garments for sexual purposes. I saw fashion accessories and my mind started buzzing. Around this time I learned to crochet.
In 2009 I crocheted a soft pink harness and wore it to Folsom. The harness got an immediate, strong and positive reaction, people took pictures, and I was hooked (crochet pun intended). Each year after, I produced another crocheted harness. I experimented with different styles and colors (including a jock strap). I amassed a good number of these harnesses, and I realized that I was designing a fashion line. 
Fast forward to now, and I’ve assembled a team to make a go of this. We named the dang things, and narrowed our line down to three Yarness styles (for now); we’ve fine-tuned designs, sourced yarn, figured out marketing and developed a production model to pay crafters for their time (see below for more details on that).
Yarness is fetish and fashion, and most of all fun. We hope you enjoy them as much as we do!THE PERKSThe Hater Tee ($25) - added 7/10Now you can take your snark offline, or support your love for Yarness! No one will ever know!The Folsom Splash ($20) - added 7/9We are planning to make a giant splash at Folsom Street Fair on Sunday, September 21, 2014. We want to make the biggest, most amazing Yarness event yet, and we'd love to get your ideas and have your input. If you donate at this perk level you'll have an opportunity to work with us to design our Folsom presence, you'll help defray the costs of yarn, hardware, models, social media exposure and anything else it takes to build this soft-fetishy work of art. You'll also be contributing to the fun, creative, quirky and artistic spirt of Yarness.The Lock ($75) - added 7/8Yarn Jewelry. Yup. We’ve transformed that s/m symbol of a master/slave relationship, the chain and padlock, and turned it into the softest, cutest necklace this side of the Folsom Street Fair.
The 3 Yarness Designs ($80)The Classic is the fundamental Yarness, a simple but effective "X" across the chest and back.The Bulldog Yarness crosses your chest and back, rests high on your body and draws attention to your chest. A good choice for broad fellows.The Trucker Yarness goes around your shoulders and crosses in back, then attaches to your front belt loops. OMG it holds up pants like suspenders! Yarness All-over Tee (Custom Tee Perk) ($65)It's like you are wearing Yarness but you are wearing a t-shirt. It's thrilling, we promise. These shirts are printed using dye sublimation to allow for full frontal action. Choose from from the below designs and we plan to add additional designs later. DIY Yarness Kit, make a Yarness yourself! ($29)We will send you everything you need to make your own Yarness including the a pattern for the style of your choice, a crochet hook, the yarn, adjusters and rings. You will also have access to a Google Hangout with  Ryan  where he will teach you how to crochet. There will be 5 scheduled hangouts for you to choose from. Yarness Tank ($39)A comfy tank from American Apparel that allows you to rock your Yarness persuasion. Sizes XS - XL available.
Custom Yarness ($222)
You and the Yarness team design a Yarness just for you. We'll figure out a design and then make it. It will be one-of-a-kind and unforgettable. Let's talk.Yarn(ess)Bomb ($1234)We are prepared to yarnbomb something of your choosing in San Francisco with a mega crochet creation. Don't you worry, we will document the creation and installation of the piece extensively on social media. Your idea must be able to be crocheted in under 25 hours and be feasible to install IRL. Yarness San Francisco Adventure ($2500)We want to welcome you to our beautiful city and make you a one-of-a-kind Yarness. You get:

Roundtrip tickets to San Francisco (domestic flights only, we decide on a date together and we book it)


1 night stay in San Francisco


Fun night on the town with the Yarness crew

Personal measurement session

Custom Yarness designed and made just for you

FAQDon't these Yarnesses stretch?Yarnesses are made to fit tightly to your body. When you first wear them they will be snug, then stretch a bit as the knots sit into themselves. We incorporate this into our measurements. Additionally, each Yarness has adjustable sliders, so you are able to tighten the garment as much as you would like. A Yarness is not a leather harness, and should not be expected to behave as such. But trust us, you can pull on them, play with them and they are not going to break anytime soon.How should I wear a Yarness?You can wear a Yarness tight on your skin like a fetish garment or over your clothing as a accessory. A Yarness can dress up a outfit, especially if you pick a color that pops.Do Yarnesses behave like leather harnesses?Yarnesses are inspired by leather harnesses, but while light, durable and fun,  they are something else entirely. But don't worry, you can play with a yarness just like you would a harness. Did we just blow your mind? When can I expect my Yarness? Depending on the size of this campaign we will produce yarnesses on a first come, first serve basis. We guarantee an end-of-year delivery for Yarnesses, but if you want your Yarness now we have the special "InstaYarness" order option. Do you ship internationally? We do, but for an additional amount for shipping. After you make your order, we will follow up with you with the additional cost.
How do I order the Yarness? Place your order on Indiegogo, and once the crowdfunding campaign has finished, we will direct you to an online form where you can indicate your style, color, and sizing preferences.The YarnWe are using Universal Yarn, a anti-pilling acrylic yarn that has a solid hold and a great selection of bright colors. Yarnesses are vegan. How are Yarnesses made?Our production model recycles money back into the hands of local skilled crafters. We have a team of crocheters and we pay them a fair wage for their time making Yarnesses. We could have outsourced production, but we are committed to supporting local makers for work that they rarely get paid for. The price of a Yarness includes the cost of our manufacturing model. You are buying a US-made handcrafted good. If you are interested in becoming a maker, please visit: http://yarness.me/make/Why Crowdfunding?After wearing Yarnesses for years, countless people have asked where to buy one. This is only anecdotal evidence, and without any large investors in the project we decided to crowdfund Yarness to help us:1. Gauge demand - How many people actually want this? Doing this campaign will help us understand the scale of the project.2. Build capital - The money we make with this campaign will help us buy supplies/inventory, pay makers and market the product.3. Establish urgency - Look, we could go open an Etsy store but that's hard to get the word out about. With only 43 days to purchase a Yarness we are hoping to gather all orders at once to make production a lot more manageable.Any other questions? Email us at info@yarness.meFrom Ryan and Brian, thanks!
